definition: to assault a fortified position/(fig.) to concentrate one's efforts on a particularly difficult part of one's mission
to tackle a thorny problem and overcome its challenges

sentences.english: Mio Wei stressed that over the next five years is the critical period of China's industrial transformation and upgrading.
sentences.chinese: 苗圩強調，未來五年是我國工業轉型升級的攻堅時期。

sentences.english: We will strive to conserve energy and reduce emissions.
sentences.chinese: 打好節能減排攻堅戰和持久戰。

sentences.english: Wang Yi said that this round of talks was convened when the peace talk process had entered a most critical stage.
sentences.chinese: 王毅說，本次會談是在和談進程進入攻堅階段召開的。

sentences.english: We should unswervingly uphold the poverty alleviation policy to lead all rural works in the poverty-stricken areas.
sentences.chinese: 堅持以扶貧攻堅總攬貧困地區農村工作全局。

sentences.english: At present, we must transfer all active factors to resolve the problem of employment.
sentences.chinese: 當前我們應調動一切積極因素，打好就業攻堅戰。

sentences.english: But it's a waste of precious time to fight that uphill battle.
sentences.chinese: 不過打這樣一場攻堅戰其實是在浪費寶貴的時間。

sentences.english: The vitals of assault on reform is the reform on government system.
sentences.chinese: 改革攻堅的要害是政府體制改革。

sentences.english: The new trebuchets offer an incredibly powerful option for city assaults.
sentences.chinese: 新的投石機爲城市攻堅提供了強大的手段。

sentences.english: Battle of assault fortified positions is initiated in night.
In our country , the reform is in the stage of storming fortifications , the development is in the key time.
sentences.chinese: 在國內，改革進入了攻堅階段，發展進入了關鍵時期。

sentences.english: We will continue to work to bring coalmine gases under control and to remedy safety problems in coal mines.
sentences.chinese: 繼續打好煤礦瓦斯治理和礦山整頓兩個攻堅戰。

sentences.english: If the bell rang, 'It is bad', you had to make an apology to the head in a low voice for leave.
sentences.chinese: 你得匆匆向頭兒小聲道歉，告假去開始又一輪攻堅。

definition: hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
to muster troops/(fig.) to gather forces
the net of justice/rigorous process of the law/the long arm of the law
